p: As in ref. 4, we apply the Advanced Circulation (ADCIRC) model ( 52) to simulate the storm surges induced by all synthetic storms. ADCIRC is a finite-element hydrodynamic model that has been successfully used to simulate and forecast storm-surge events for coastal regions (e.g., refs. 53 and 54). The numerical grid and modeling specifics used here were developed by Lin et al. ( 3) and used in refs. 4 and 17.
